text: Not bad. Very hoppy. Thats pretty much it. Heavy hops that leave a residual stick to your mouth. Aroma is average for a beer of this hop level. Bitter and some cardboard. Tap

Draft @ The Wharf Rat - Fells Point, Baltimore. Pours a slightly hazy golden color with a small white head. Has a fruity malty citrus hoppy aroma. Fruity malty citrus hoppy flavor. Has a fruity malty citrus hoppy bitter finish.

Location: 22 oz bottle shared by jcos, 10/30/15


Aroma: The aroma is fairly weak with notes of pale malt and dough, and maybe some subtle fruit

Appearance: Pours a mostly clear orange color with a thin beige head and light, drippy lace

Flavor: The taste is light sweet, doughy and malty, with lightly bitter herbal and spice notes

Palate: Light-medium bodied, with a slightly tingle on the tongue, and a light dry close

Overall Impression: 
Not a bad beer, but, honestly, Id probably try the crab cake cheesesteak over drinking this one again. Thats sounds just crazy enough that it could be tasty - or awful, probably awful. Not a lot more to say about the beer, but Ive now successfully made myself hungry.

22oz bottle, from SAVOR. Finally getting this to this one with some friends. Pours a nice golden amber color with a small white head. Aroma was light herbal notes, toasted malts. Flavor was some spicy hops, bready notes. Pretty tasty, though nothing mind blowing.
Pours golden with white head. Aroma is malt with herbal and floral hops. Flavor is biscuit malt with some caramel followed by citrus crispness and finishing with earthy, herbal, piney hops.

Large, off white head with good retention and lacing. Clear, amber/gold hued brew. Light nose of leaf, grass and faint fruits. Medium bodied with a soft carbonation, lil oily. Dry, toasty malts, light woody notes with some grassy hints and fruity notes. Dry finish, earthy with a tame bite. Decent. Enjoyed from a bomber at Roberts Clean the Closet tasting 2015!

Cloudy gold, nice off-white head. Mild clean citrus nose...grapefruit? Bitter start, not overpowering. Sweet malt tried to take over but fades quickly. Chewy...excellent mouthfeel. Woody bitter finish, chewy mouthfeel keep the bitterness in check.

From a bottle. Pours Amber with a bubbly off white head. Tastes like citrus hops, caramel, grapefruit, nutty malt, and toast. Light/medium body and carbonation. Smells like grapefruit, caramel, nutty malt, and toast.

Bottle. Pours mostly clear golden amber with off-white head. Aroma is floral hops, cereal and toasted malts, light caramel, light orange peel, and faint toffee. Flavor is dry and toasted with medium bitterness, nice grassy notes, and faint citrus. Medium body.

Poured a hazy dark amber color with a thin off white head. Aroma is malty with fruit, especially apples. Lots of good biscuit flavors and slightly doughy. Good flavor and balance. Aftertaste has some light fruit with spruce and bread. Nice!
From a 22 oz bottle shared at home. Pours a clear gold with an off white head. Light citrus nose. Flavors of toast and grapefruit. Bitter finish.

UPDATED: AUG 25, 2015 22 oz bottle from SAVOR shared with friends. Mostly clear golden orange with off-white head. Aromas of floral notes, malt, citrus. Tastes of citrus, floral notes, light oak, malt. Medium body with a dry finish. Solid but a bit underwhelming for a SAVOR beer.
Draft. Clear golden amber color, medium off white head. Aroma of hay, lightly toasted biscuit. Taste has earthy biscuit. Decent.
Real English style. The aroma is malty sweet with some caramel and grass. The hops come in with the flavor. Starts malty sweet with the bitterness coming in later. Very nice with a steak.

Medium dark cloudy with off-white head. Lots of earthy bitterness and medium malt character. Long bitter finish. I spent a month in England last summer drinking UK pale ales, so I can vouch for this English Pale Ales "authenticity." Classic version of a classic style from two great East coast brewers.
Refrigerated brow bomber poured into a glass. Clear golden with small white head. Aroma is light sulfur, light body, low carbonation, and little lacing. Taste is mineral malt.
